alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 12:42PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lehigh, north central Montgomery, southeastern Carbon, northwestern Bucks and Northampton Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1242 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emmaus, or near Allentown, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, Quakertown, Hellertown, Nazareth, Palmerton, East Greenville, Wind Gap, Bath, Belfast, Tatamy, Steuben, Pleasant Valley, Zionsville, Berlinsville, Lehigh University and Danielsville. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 41 and 57. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 54 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Carbon; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
